ARABIC: قَالُوا۟ لَئِنْ أَكَلَهُ ٱلذِّئْبُ وَنَحْنُ عُصْبَةٌ إِنَّآ إِذًا لَّخَٰسِرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They said, 'If a wolf does come and eat him up when together we make up a powerful group in that case we would truly be in loss!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They replied: "If a wolf should devour him when we are there, a well-knit band, we shall certainly be treacherous."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They said: "Should a wolf eat him, despite the presence of our strong group, we would indeed be a worthless lot!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They said, "If some wild-beast would be able to harm him, despite the presence of our strong group, it would certainly be a great loss to us!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They said, “If the wolf devours him, whereas we are a group, then surely we are useless!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They said: "If a wolf devours him, while we are `Usbah (a group), then surely, we are the losers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They said: Surely if the wolf should devour him notwithstanding that we are a (strong) company, we should then certainly be losers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: They said, 'If the wolf eats him, and we a band, then are we losers!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They said: If the wolf should devour him when we are (so strong) a band, then surely we should have already perished.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They said, "Surely, if the wolf devoured him while we were a strong party, we should indeed be great losers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They said: if the wolf devoured him while we were a company, we must indeed then be the losers!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They said, ‘Should the wolf eat him while we are a hardy band, then we will indeed be losers!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They said: "If the wolf were to devour him while we are (so large) a party, then should we indeed (first) have perished ourselves!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They said: "If a wolf devours him, while we are 'Usbah (a strong group) (to guard him), then surely, we are the losers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: They said: 'We are many, if a wolf devours him, then we are losers'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They said, “If the wolf ate him, and we are many, we would be good for nothing.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They said, "If a wolf should eat him while we are a [strong] clan, indeed, we would then be losers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [12:14] They said, ‘Truly if (la-in: the lām here is for oaths) the wolf were to devour him, when we are [so hardy] a band, a group, then we indeed are losers!’, incapable [of anything]. Thus, he sent him off with them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They said) to their father: (If the wolf should devour him when we are (so strong) a band) ten of us, (then surely we should have already perished) we should be very weak; it is also said that this means: we should be really losers by neglecting the inviolability of our father and brother.
